isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - ADJUSTMENTS - HOOD

svcprocinfo.para: Improper positioning of the hood relative to the cab can cause the tilt mechanism to malfunction and can interfere with engine components. The front of the hood is to be at the proper height, which will allow a parallel gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the bumper. The hood is to be centered so the clearances for the radiator and air intake box-to-splash panels and shock absorbers are adequate.

Before adjusting the hood, be sure the chassis is on a level surface and the hood is mounted properly to the cab. Adjust the radiator-to-cowl dimension, square the cab on the chassis and adjust cab air ride. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL,HOOD and ADJUSTMENTS, RADIATOR. For CAB SQUARING and CAB AIR RIDE ADJUSTMENT, refer to GROUP 16-CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Perform the following procedure for a new hood installation, or for a hood that has been removed and re-installed, to assure that the hood is positioned correctly relative to the cab, front bumper and radiator.
To adjust the hood on the 5000 Series and 9000 Series Models with and without cab air suspension system to achieve the proper spacing between the hood and cowl, use the following procedures.

svcsubproc.title: 9200 (Before July 1996) - Hood Adjustment Up or Down and Forward or Back At The Hinges

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

caution.para: To prevent damage to the hood, be sure the hood assembly is supported on an appropriate floor stand.

svcsubproc.para: To adjust the right and left side hood hinges up or down (Item 2, Figure 74) and forward or back (Item 3, Figure 74) to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specification, use the following procedure.

step1.para: Make 4 wood spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

With the hood closed and latched, try to place 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange ( Figure 75) between the hood and cowl. If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 76 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pins (Item 3) (and washers, if so equipped) at the tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), on both sides.
Pull out the retaining pins (Item 4) that secure the tilt assist spring assemblies clevis (Item 6) to the tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), on both sides.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 74 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise stated.
Reach underneath the bumper and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the hinge adjustment bolts and nuts (Item 1) and push the hood forward and down (Items 3 and 2) at both hinges (Item 5).
Position 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange ( Figure 75). Use the other 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks to check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side.

Carefully close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and are sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks, push the hood up or down (Item 2) at both hinges (Item 5) to meet the hood-to-bumper spacing of approximately 2.14 inches (54.39 mm) between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper. Check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side with the other 2 spacer blocks.

When the hood-to-cowl and hood-to-bumper dimensions are properly set, and the bottom front edge of the hood is parallel to the line of the bumper, tighten the 2 hinge adjustment bolts and nuts (Item 1) on each hinge.

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies during installation, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 76 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Position the tilt assist spring assemblies clevis (Item 6) at the tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), on both sides.
Install the retaining pins (Item 4) (and washers, if so equipped).
Install the cotter pins (Item 3) in the retaining pins (Item 4) securing the tilt assist spring assemblies to the tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), on both sides.

step1.para: Remove the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 9400 (Before July 1996) - Hood Adjustment Up or Down at the Hood Hinge Plates

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

svcsubproc.para: To adjust the right and left side hood mounted hinge plates up or down (Item 4, Figure 79) to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specifications, use the following procedure.

step1.para: Make 4 wood spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

With the hood closed and latched, try to place 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange ( Figure 75) between the hood and cowl. If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to the full open position.
Refer to Figure 79for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Loosen (to finger tight) but do not remove, the 4 hood hinge adjustment bolts and nuts (Item 1) and push the hood up (Item 4), if the hood is too far away from the cowl, or down (Item 4) if the hood is too close to the cowl, at both hood hinge plates (Item 2). Tighten the 4 adjustment bolts and nuts.
Position 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange ( Figure 75). Use the other 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks to check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side.

Carefully close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and are sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides. Check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side with the other 2 spacer blocks. Also check to see that the gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper is approximately 1.54 inches (39.09 mm) and the hood is parallel to the line of the bumper.

If the hood cannot be closed and latched, so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the spacer blocks or the hood is not parallel to the line of the bumper, repeat the above procedure. It may be necessary to adjust the hood forward or back at the chassis hinge plates (Item 3) along with adjusting the hood up or down to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specification. Refer to 9400 (Before July 1996) - Hood Adjustment Forward or Back at the Chassis Hinge Plates below.

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to the full open position. Remove the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange. Make sure the hinge adjustment bolts and nut (Item 1) are tight.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (after March 1997) - Hood Adjustment Forward or Back at the Hinge Bracket

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

svcsubproc.para: To adjust the hood hinge bracket (Item 1, Figure 82) forward or back (Item 2, Figure 82) to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specification, use the following procedure.

note.para: On 9200 and 9400 Models (after July 1996) and 9100 Model (after March 1997), the hood hinge bracket is not adjustable up or down; the gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper is now fixed.

step1.para: Make 4 wood spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

With the hood closed and latched, try to place 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange ( Figure 75) between the hood and cowl. If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.

Remove 4 mounting nuts (Item 1, Figure 83), 2 each side, and remove the grille (Item 2, Figure 83) before adjusting the hood. This will allow access to the 3 hinge bracket adjustment bolts (Item 3, Figure 82). The nuts (Item 4, Figure 82) are welded to the bottom of the hinge bracket mounting plate (Item 5, Figure 82).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Position 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange ( Figure 75). Use the other 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks to check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Reach through the grille opening and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 3 hinge bracket adjustment bolts (Item 3) and push the hood forward (Item 2) at the hinge bracket (Item 1).

Close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks and the hood-to-cowl dimension properly set, check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side with the other 2 spacer blocks. Then check for equal spacing between the cowl flange and the inside edge of the hood. Tighten the 3 hinge bracket adjustment bolts (Item 3). Tighten to 80 to 105 ft-lbs. (108 to 142 Nm).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood.
Remove the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.
Position the grille (Item 2, Figure 83) in place over the 4 studs, 2 each side, and install the 4 mounting nuts (Item 1, Figure 83)
